title: Flickr: Type & Lettering from India
content:
I just had a wonderful trip to India and took a lot of photos. Some of them my girlfriend thought was wierd and it’s exactly these I wanted to show you. As you can guess, they are type-related.

[http://flickr.com/photos/goransoderstrom/sets/72157610802315634/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209004226/http:/flickr.com/photos/goransoderstrom/sets/72157610802315634/ "http://flickr.com/photos/goransoderstrom/sets/72157610802315634/")

Cheers!

 [‹ Unicode programmer font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209004226/http:/typophile.com/node/41253 "Go to previous forum topic") [Suggestions for a Multi-Weight/Width Slab Serif? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081209004226/http:/typophile.com/node/52413 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Goran Soderstrom

comments.content: Nice! Thanks for sharing these. I was in Kolkata, India, myself in 2002 and only wish I had the affinity for type the way I do now. The very limited signage I did photograph is so beautiful; so much is done so well by hand. I hope you enjoyed your trip. India is an amazing experience.

<cite>I was in Kolkata, India, myself in 2002 and only wish I had the affinity for type the way I do now.</cite>

Then you have a good reason to go back :)

Love the Godrej script. Very interesting. Thanks for sharing these Goran!

JonE.
